channel.title: google Os
channel.description:
[url]https://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/technology/8139711.stm[/url]
So I was wondering what everyone was thinking about this new OS, or if you hadn't heard about it, it's here. personally, I'm confident they can pull off something respectable, but as a small scale operating system. they have experience .

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
I open about 150 tabs at once when I read 4chan.

Firefox only slows down when I have about 20 youtube tabs open at once.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Level:

I had about 30 tabs open today and, yeah, the memory usage isn’t so hot. That needs to be worked on.

Pretty sure 30 tabs with any browser would eat a lot of memory…

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: NavMan
item.description:
I tried Chrome on my netbook for a few days but I missed adblock plus too much and firefox was faster.

Read full topic

it’s not exactly an os, it seems to me its a browser that doesnt need an existing os
I will check it, it looks nice for a netbook

item.title: google Os

Same. Chrome works flawlessly almost all the time, but I miss certain features I had in Opera. Plugins would make it perfect.
.

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
I have occasionally had Chrome crash all its tabs, but usually it’s just the one and the rest are ok. Most of the time it works brilliantly.

Read full topic

My mom has a google android cell phone, I think it rocks.

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Same here. I have crashed tabs every so often, and closing just those ones works out fine for me.

You’re doing it wrong Right4dead

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Teh_Casino
item.description:
Right4Dead:

2-day bump, I know but I just want to say that it better not be like Google Chrome.
That thing was advertised as super fast and usefull, yet in the end it was slower and buggier. For example, google said that the browser wouldn’t crash, but would instead close the non responding tabs, that would be pretty cool if it didn’t close all the tabs, therefore closing the browser.

I’m using Google Chrome right now, and it’s serving me very well.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Headlocker
item.description:
I also though Google had release a new app or a legitimate cereal called “Google-O’s”
ON TOPIC:
I read about this on LH a while ago. It’s a distro version of linux and that’s all they really know at this point. It was mostly a “what users want to see in the OS” post. But I do know that gOS 3.1 SP1 recently came out which is what i’m using for linux and VirtualBox at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
I saw this coming a few years ago. I bet my dad doesn’t remember, but I totally told him “I bet google will make an OS some day”, and he was like “no, they’ll stick with their internet blah blah blah”.

I totally called it.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
From the TWHL forums

Tito:

Man, it looks like Google wants to be another Microsoft!
Search Engine…CHECK!
Online Advertising…CHECK!
Web Browser…CHECK!
Cell Phone OS…CHECK!
PC Operating System…CHECK!

What’s next?..The Google game console?

The_(c)Striker:

Google Cars, Gokia(cellphone), Gutube, Gadio, Gikipedia, Gvidia, etc … Ginux ?

I dunno. I’m not trading in my XP for anything if I can help it. And I doubt that anything google makes will be free for much longer.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
Lamsey:

Not sure how the “the browser is the os” idea will work, but I’ll be interested to see how it plays out.

Lamsey:

I meant more in terms of the browser being the place where apps live, rather than the Program Files or /bin folder.

…just look at GMail and Google Docs and the upcoming Google Waves for examples.

Huh? I just responded to what you said, not my fault if you can’t express yourself properly.

Read full topic

item.title: google Os
item.dc:creator: Lamsey
item.description:
Hence “more and more stuff”. Geez, it’s like you people are deliberately misreading me

Read full topic
